SEARCH
Package org.wildloop

Class World

java.lang.Object
org.wildloop.World
public class World extends Object
Represents the simulation world where animals can move and interact. The world is organized as a two-dimensional grid where each cell can contain one animal.
See Also:
  • Animal
  • Position
  • Direction

    • addAnimal

      public void addAnimal(Animal animal)
      Adds a new animal to the world.
      Parameters:
      animal - animal to add
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an animal is null or its position is invalid
      IllegalStateException - if the target cell is already occupied

    • removeAnimal

      public void removeAnimal(Animal animal)
      Removes an animal from the world.
      Parameters:
      animal - animal to remove
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the animal is null
      IllegalStateException - if an animal does not exist in the world or its position is invalid

    • isValidPosition

      public boolean isValidPosition(Position position)
      Checks if a given position is within world boundaries.
      Parameters:
      position - position to check
      Returns:
      true if the position is valid, false otherwise

    • isCellEmpty

      public boolean isCellEmpty(Position position)
      Checks if cell at given position is empty.
      Parameters:
      position - position to check
      Returns:
      true if the cell is empty, false otherwise

    • tick

      public void tick()
      Executes one simulation turn, updating the state of all animals and incrementing turn counter.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the simulation world.
